sentence: Here's your Investing Action Plan for Tuesday: what you need to know as an investor for the coming day.

[ibd-display-video id=2839602 width=50 float=left autostart=true]There are a flurry of earnings before the Thanksgiving holiday with Salesforce ( CRM ), Dollar Tree ( DLTR ), Apple ( AAPL ) iPhone chipmaker Analog Devices ( ADI ), Lowe's ( LOW ), HP (HPQ), Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), Burlington Stores (BURL) on tap for Tuesday.
Salesforce is expected to report unadjusted earnings per share of 37 cents, up 54% when it reports third-quarter results late Tuesday.
Revenue is seen rising 23.5% to $2.65 billion.
Earlier this month, the software-as-a-service leader said it expects over 20% organic revenue growth through 2022.
Shares fell 0.2% to 107.37 on the stock market today , extended above buying range after breaking out from a flat base last month.
The chipmaker will announce fiscal Q4 results before the market open on Tuesday.
Analysts expect Analog to report a 31% jump in EPS to $1.37 with sales up 50% to $1.5 billion.
Analog Devices was among three top chip stocks that got a price target at Jefferies last month as the Internet of Things continues to drive long-term demand.
Analog Devices also makes chips for the Apple iPhone.
Shares were up 2.9% to 93.07, hitting a 17-year high.
Analog Devices is extended from a buy range after breaking out in September.
IBD'S TAKE:Buying or holding a stock can be risky heading into an earnings report.
Here's anearnings options strategythat can help you cash in on post-earnings stock gains, while minimizing the risk from a weak quarter.
Analysts expect HP's EPS to climb 22% to 44 cents, with revenue rising 6.5% to $13.33 billion.
At a recent analyst day event, the PC and printer maker said it expects to earn $1.74 to $1.84 a share in fiscal 2018, which starts Nov. 1, topping consensus estimates.

Analysts expect Hewlett Packard Enterprise to report a drop in EPS to 28 cents a share vs. 61 cents a year earlier, with revenue down 38% to $7.72 billion, following divestitures of its software and enterprise services businesses.
HP rose 1.7% to 22.12, matching a recent seven-year closing high.
Hewlett Packard Enterprise climbed 3% to 14.09, moving above its 200-day line and closing just below its 50-day.
The deep-discount chain reports Q3 earnings early Tuesday.
EPS is seen rising 11% to 90 cents on revenue of $5.282 billion, up 6%.
Despite remodeling the layouts of its Family Dollar stores and strong same store sales, Dollar Tree is facing steep competition from Wal-Mart (WMT), Dollar General (DG) and Europe's Aldi.
The home improvement store will also announce results early Tuesday.
EPS is seen climbing 16% to $1.02 with revenue up 5.3% to $16.67 billion.
Larger rival Home Depot (HD) raised its full year outlook after reporting stronger-than-expected Q3 results last week.
Lowe's jumped 1.55% to 81.46, closing on a cup with handle base buy point of 82.84.
The off-price apparel retailer will report EPS early Tuesday.
Analysts see EPS climbing 30% to 65 cents with sales up 7% to $1.44 billion.
Burlington rose 1.7% to 106.55, hitting a record high.
Burlington Stores became extended from a 96.73 buy point on Friday following strong results from off-price peer Ross Stores (ROST).
